Posts.Content: Apr 30, 2012 10:58PM CyndiF wrote: Hi LeeLee,       There are many posts here and I've skimmed them, but I get the general idea.  There is a saying that states basically  -  Don't borrow trouble from tomorrow,  you have enough trouble to deal with today.  I can understand your fear and anxiety and it's understandable - but you are little the fear rule your life and do more damage to your spirit than cancer ever could.  I have a friend who is in remission from ovarian cancer but her tumor markers are getting a little higher each time she goes in.  She's gotten to CT scans since they started to climb and they show no evidence of cancer.  She lives in fear that the cancer will return at any moment.   That fear colors her life.  The internet is a dangerous place to go for information.  When I was first diagnosed I went everywhere looking for information,  including this cite.  I found something about a certain type of cancer and was convinced I had that cause it looked like I had some of the symptoms.  I didn't.  My cancer was a stage 3b and that was in 2008 and I'm still here.  The road is tough but it's not an impossible one.
Posts.Title: so worried I have breast cancer leelee101 leelee101
